intro: Ferula tadshikorum, commonly known as the Tadzhikistan cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a strong, pungent scent. Ferula tadshikorum is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
